Mod can be found in our [KerboKatz - SmallUtilities](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/104505-111-kerbokatz-smallutilities-30042016-partial-11-update/)!

Did you ever...

- Crash a craft while landing and it fell apart into many many pieces
- Land on water but your craft tipped over and again fell apart into many tiny pieces

... and you didn't want to recover them all one by one ?

Or...

- Want to destroy all your debris in space but didn't want to bother ?

KerboKatz got the solution to all your troubles/problems. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Proudly presenting you RecoverAll/DestroyAll. A plugin which lets you recover/Destroy all your vessels with just one click.

Don't worry about recovering/destroying all the tiny parts of your craft after a failed landing.

Or about having to destroy all your booster stages one by one

[![KH2GIS7h.png](http://i.imgur.com/KH2GIS7h.png)](http://i.imgur.com/KH2GIS7.png)

* * *

**FAQ**

**Q: How do i install this mod ?**

A: The zip files are all structured so that you only have to extract them into your kerbal folder and overwrite the folder.

**Q: How do i uninstall this mod ?**

A: I'm sorry that you want to do that. Just remove the "RecoverAll" folder in your "GameData\KerboKatz" folder. If you aren't using any of our other mods you can remove the "KerboKatz" folder too. If you have a few minutes please tell us what you didn't like about this mod. So we can improve it.

**Q: This mod isn't working ?!!!!**

A: Make sure you got the KerboKatzUtilities. If you do so please post your output\_log so we can investigate your issues.

**Q: I installed with CKAN and it's not working!**

A: Even though we let CKAN generate meta files for our mods we don't actively check if its actually working or has the newest version. In cases with issues that can't be reproduced with a manual install, it's suggested to take it to the CKAN guys.

**Q: How do i access this mod?**

A: By clicking on the green cat icon another small "toolbar" will pop up with all of our active mods listed in it and you can chose this mod out of the list. By left-clicking the main window will pop up.

**Q: I have issues with this mod.**

A: Please post your output\_log, detailed description and reproduction steps so we can investigate your issues.

**Q: I have a suggestion for this mod.**

A: Just post it in this thread. We always like new ideas. But please be aware that some things might not be doable.

**Q: I like your mod how can i thank you ?**

A: Just post something in this thread. We like reputation points too ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif). If you feel like it you can donate to us too.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-30T08:50:55Z" title="04/30/2016 08:50  AM" data-short="8 yr">April 30, 2016</time> by SpaceTiger**

Good idea, but does it just recover indiscriminately, or only parts in proximity to each other? The latter feature would be nice in case anyone has vehicles or flags on Kerbin they don't want recovered.

It generates a list with all crafts/objects on kerbin that are splashed down or landed on the ground. This list will get filtered based on the settings. The remaining of the list will be shown. Now you can decide which of those objects you don't want to recover by simply unchecking the green box in front of the name. If you crash a vessel it will most likely generate a lot debris and all those pieces will have their own row in the list. At the end just click on the "recover all vessels" button and everything that was still checked will be recovered.

Whoa this is pretty useful! I wonder if it'll work properly with darkmultiplayer without desync issues, will try to test later.

Edit: Yep it works fine on dmp
